flawed_nl_solution:
Jose has half as many bottles of domestic wine as imported wine, or 2400/2=<<2400/2=1200>>1200 bottles of domestic wine.
In total, he has 2400+1200=<<2400+1200=360>>360 bottles of wine.
If the guests drink one-third of all his wine, then they will have consumed 360/3=<<360/3=120>>120 bottles of wine.
Thus, after the party, Jose's private cellar will have 360-120=<<360-120=240>>240 remaining bottles of wine.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 3600.0, not 360.0. It appears a zero was dropped from the number.
